name: rrf_overlap_boost
description: RRF with k=60 gives strong bonus to overlapping docs.
insight: With k=60, RRF score is ~1/61 per list. Overlap gives ~2/61, beating any single-list doc.

name: combmnz_overlap_multiplier
description: CombMNZ multiplies by overlap count, boosting shared docs.
insight: score = normalized_sum × appearance_count. Overlap docs get 2× multiplier.

name: rank_based_beats_outlier
description: Score-based methods struggle with outliers; rank-based ignore them.
insight: Rank-based methods (RRF/ISR/Borda) ignore score magnitude entirely.

name: weighted_downweight_bad
description: Weighted fusion with 0.9/0.1 controls bad retriever B.
insight: When retriever quality is known a priori, explicit weighting helps.

name: all_equal_agreement
description: When retrievers agree, all fusion methods produce same ranking.
insight: Perfect agreement is the degenerate case where fusion doesn't matter.

name: borda_penalizes_erratic
description: Borda count penalizes docs with inconsistent rankings across lists.
insight: Borda score = sum(N - rank). Erratic #1/#10 loses to consistent #2/#2.

name: combsum_calibrated
description: CombSUM is effective when both retrievers have calibrated scores.
insight: With calibrated scores, sum directly reflects combined confidence.

name: rrf_deep_overlap
description: RRF k=60 makes overlap dominate even for deep-ranked docs.
insight: 1/(60+r) varies only 10% between r=1 and r=5. Overlap = 2× contribution.

name: graceful_empty
description: All methods handle empty input gracefully.
insight: Edge case: empty list should not cause errors or distort ranking.

name: disagreement_interleave
description: When retrievers disagree completely, need fair interleaving.
insight: With disjoint results, all methods must interleave somehow.

name: dbsf_distribution_mismatch
description: DBSF z-score helps align genuinely different distributions.
insight: Z-score: (x - mean) / std. Aligns distributions with different means/variances.

name: isr_steeper_decay
description: ISR's steeper decay (k=1) emphasizes top ranks in disjoint lists.
insight: ISR with k=1: 1/sqrt(2)=0.71 at r=1 vs 1/sqrt(6)=0.41 at r=5. Steeper than RRF. rel1 at rank 0 should dominate.

name: standardized_distribution_mismatch
description: Standardized fusion (z-score) outperforms CombSUM when distributions differ.
insight: Z-score normalization (standardization) is more robust to distribution differences than min-max. ERANK shows 2-5% NDCG improvement.

name: standardized_tight_clipping
description: Tight clipping range helps when moderate outliers exist.
insight: Tighter clipping [-2, 2] vs [-3, 3] reduces outlier influence while maintaining distribution alignment. With tight clipping, relevant docs rank higher.

name: additive_multi_task_ecommerce
description: Additive multi-task fusion (ResFlow) for e-commerce ranking.
insight: ResFlow: additive fusion (CTR + CTCVR × 20) outperforms multiplicative for e-commerce. Task B (CTCVR) gets 20× weight.

name: additive_equal_weights
description: Equal-weight additive fusion when both tasks matter equally.
insight: Equal weights (1.0, 1.0) when both tasks contribute equally to final ranking.

name: standardized_vs_dbsf
description: Standardized fusion with custom clipping vs fixed DBSF.
insight: Standardized allows configurable clipping range, making it more flexible than DBSF's fixed [-3, 3].

name: standardized_negative_scores
description: Standardized fusion handles negative scores naturally.
insight: Z-score normalization works with any score distribution, including negative values.

name: additive_extreme_weights
description: Additive fusion with extreme weight ratios (1:100).
insight: Extreme weights should still produce valid rankings. Task B dominates.

name: standardized_single_element
description: Standardized fusion handles single-element lists gracefully.
insight: Single-element lists have zero variance. Z-score = 0, but fusion still works.

name: additive_disjoint_tasks
description: Additive fusion when tasks have disjoint document sets.
insight: Disjoint tasks should interleave documents fairly.

name: standardized_outlier_robustness
description: Standardized fusion is more robust to outliers than CombSUM.
insight: Z-score normalization with clipping reduces outlier influence compared to min-max.

name: additive_normalization_matters
description: Normalization method affects additive multi-task fusion results.
insight: Z-score normalization (default) handles different distributions better than min-max. With equal weights, rel1 should win.

name: standardized_many_lists
description: Standardized fusion scales to many input lists.
insight: Z-score normalization works efficiently with many lists.

name: additive_ecommerce_funnel
description: E-commerce funnel: view, click, add-to-cart, purchase.
insight: ResFlow shows additive fusion works well for e-commerce multi-task ranking.
